title: 113_s2711
content: The Act is titled the "United States Commission on International Religious Freedom Reform and Reauthorization Act of 2014." It establishes the composition of the commission. The United States Commission on International Religious Freedom Reform and Reauthorization Act of 2014 establishes the composition of the commission. The Act amends the leadership election process, specifying that the Chair and Vice Chair shall be elected by a majority of the Members present and voting at the first meeting after May 30 of each year. Initial elections in 2015 require the Chair to be appointed by a different political party than the President's, with the Vice Chair appointed by the President's party. Future elections starting in 2016 follow a similar process. The Commission on International Religious Freedom Reform and Reauthorization Act of 2014 amends the leadership election process, with the Chair and Vice Chair elected by Members of different political parties on an annual basis after May 30, 2016. Term limits prevent Members from serving as Chair or Vice Chair for a second term. Additionally, subsection (f) addresses attendance at meetings of the Ambassador at Large for International Religious Freedom. The Ambassador at Large for International Religious Freedom must be notified of all Commission meetings and can attend as a non-voting member. Vacancies in appointments will no longer have a second sentence in the amendment. The Commission has powers outlined in Section 3. Section 203(e) of the International Religious Freedom Act of 1998 (22 U.S.C. 6432a) is amended to allow Members of the Commission to speak as private citizens. Statements on behalf of the Commission must be issued in writing and approved by at least six of the nine Members. Individual or dissenting views may be included in statements. The Commission must clearly describe its statutory authority in written statements. The Commission must clearly describe its statutory authority in both written and oral statements. SEC. 4. COMMISSION PERSONNEL MATTERS. The International Religious Freedom Act of 1998 is amended to allow the Commission to appoint staff personnel and make decisions on hiring, firing, and pay by an affirmative vote of at least six members. Members appointed by the President's political party have the authority to appoint a Majority Staff Director and three professional staff members. The Commission can appoint staff personnel and make staffing decisions by an affirmative vote of at least six members. Members appointed by the President's political party can appoint a Majority Staff Director and three professional staff members, while members appointed by a different political party can appoint a Minority Staff Director and three professional staff members. Staff appointments are made without regard to certain classification provisions. The Commission appoints staff personnel based on political party affiliation. The Majority Staff Director and Minority Staff Director must not exceed the pay rate for level V of the Executive Schedule. Professional staff must have expertise in international religious freedom issues. Conforming amendments are made to ensure proper staffing. SEC. 5. REPORT OF COMMISSION. The publication date for the report under the International Religious Freedom Act of 1998 is amended. Consensus on reports by Commission members is required. SEC. 6. AUTHORIZATION OF APPROPRIATIONS. SEC. 6. Authorization of appropriations amended from 2014 to 2016. SEC. 7. Termination date amended from September 30, 2014, to September 30, 2016.
